monogr.title: Parthenophil and Parthenophe : Sonnettes, madrigals, elegies and odes. To the right noble and vertuous gentleman, M. William Percy Esquier, his deerest friend
monogr.author: Barnes, Barnabe

div.head: TO THE BEAVTIFVLL LADY THE Lady Brigett Manners.

lg.l: Rose of that garlande, (fayrest, and sweetest
Of all those sweet and faire flowers:
Pride of chast Cynthias rich crowne,)
Receaue this verse, thy matchlesse bewtie meetest:
Behold thy graces which thou greetest,
Of thine and such like bewties, here set downe,
Here shalt thou finde thy frowne,
Fames plumes flye with thy loues which should be fleetest,
Here my toues tempestes, and showers.
These read (sweet bewtie) whom my muse shall crowne,
Who for thee such a garland is compyling

closer.signed: Your bewties most affectionate seruant. BARNABE BARNES.
